page.title: 17Milking Time.
page.content: Every morning the farmer gets up at 6.00 a.m. so that he is ready to begin milking at 6.30 a.m. The cows are led, six at a time, into the milking parlour. The cows' udders are washed and the clusters of the milking machine are put on and they start milking. After ten minutes they stop and another six cows are sent in, until all 35 cows have been milked. The udders are disinfected before the gate is opened and the cows are sent back into the yard, then out into the field until 4.30 p.m. when they are milked again. Meanwhile the milk is pumped through pipes via a strainer sock to the bulk tank where it is stored at an even, cool temperature until the milk tanker comes to collect it and take it to Stroud Creamery.
